groan.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to make a long deep sound because you are in pain, upset, or disappointed, or because something is very enjoyable
groan.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The kids all groaned when I switched off the TV.
Richard’s jokes make you groan rather than laugh.
As she kissed him, Gary groaned with pleasure.
groan.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I’m tired of him moaning and groaning all the time.
groan.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to make a low deep sound
groan.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The old tree groaned in the wind.
groan.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if a table groans with food, there is a very large amount of food on it
groan.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a long deep sound that you make when you are in pain or do not want to do something
groan.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Casey let out a groan of protest.
groan.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The door opened with a groan.
